com.bachelor_project.reactive

Class Program

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bachelor_project.reactive.Program

  • public class Program
extends Object
    Encodes an executable interpretation of an SRL program.
    Author:
    Alexandru Babeanu

    • Constructor Detail

      • Program

        public Program(List<String> signalList,
               List<String> sharedData,
               Map<String,FunctionDefinition> declarations,
               StatementSequence statements)
        Constructs an executable interpretation of an SRL program. Requires the signal interface, declared through the signal_domain construct, the list of shared variables declared through the shared_data construct, the table that encodes the functions declared using the let construct, and the encoding of the program instructions.
        Parameters:
        signalList - a list of the signal names in the signal interface of the program
        sharedData - a list of identifiers for shared variables
        declarations - a table that maps each function name to the FunctionDefinition object that encodes said function
        statements - the sequence of program instructions

    • Method Detail

      • getScheduler

        public Scheduler getScheduler()
        Offers access to the underlying Scheduler object.
        Returns:
        the underlying Scheduler object
        See Also:
        Scheduler

      • getGlobalScope

        public Map<String,Statement> getGlobalScope()
        Returns a Map view of the global scope of the program. This scope consists of a table that maps the identifiers of the shared variables declared with the shared_data construct to the Statement objects used to encode them.
        Returns:
        a Map view of the global scope of the program
        See Also:
        Value, LockedPointer

      • addLocalSignal

        public String addLocalSignal()
        Creates a new entry in the signal table and returns the signal name. This new name is obtained by concatenating the symbol "#" with a number. It is ensured to be unique, because user declared identifiers cannot start with the symbol "#" and the number is always incremented.
        Returns:
        a new, unique, signal name

      • subscribeToSignalTable

        public io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable subscribeToSignalTable(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<Map<String,Boolean>> consumer)
        Allows threads to subscribe to the signal table.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the object that performs the event reaction
        Returns:
        a Disposable object used to unsubscribe from the observable
        See Also:
        Observable.subscribe(), Disposable

      • subscribeToInstantSignaler

        public io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable subscribeToInstantSignaler(io.reactivex.functions.Consumer<Map<String,Boolean>> consumer)
        Allows threads to subscribe to the underlying PublishSubject, which will notify them when an instant has ended.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the object that performs the event reaction
        Returns:
        a Disposable object used to unsubscribe from the observable
        See Also:
        PublishSubject, Observable.subscribe(), Disposable

      • emitSignal

        public void emitSignal(String signalName)
                throws RuntimeException
        Makes a signal present in the signal environment.
        Parameters:
        signalName - the name of the emitted signal
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - when the name of the emitted signal is not in the table

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws RuntimeException,
                    IOException
        Executes the interpreted program.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        IOException

      • callFunction

        public void callFunction(String functionName,
                         List<Parameter> parameterList,
                         SignalGuard guard)
                  throws RuntimeException
        Executes a call to a function declared via the let construct. Calls the FunctionDefinition.call(com.bachelor_project.reactive.SignalGuard, java.util.List) method of the FunctionDefinition object that is mapped to the provided function name in the table of functions.
        Parameters:
        functionName - the name of the function being called
        parameterList - a list of Parameter objects encoding the call arguments
        guard - the SignalGuard object associated with the current Thread
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - when the function name does not match any declared function
        See Also:
        FunctionDefinition.call(com.bachelor_project.reactive.SignalGuard, java.util.List), Parameter, SignalGuard

      • keywordDefinitions

        public static Map<String,FunctionDefinition> keywordDefinitions()
        Returns a table containing all the functions that are inherently defined in the language.
        Returns:
        a table that maps each language construct to its encoding FunctionDefinition object
